snippet: Two recent cases involving a patient kept alive by ventilator despite a diagnosis of brain death raise questions about exactly what this term means.
abstract: Wrenching stories of two families shocked to learn that a loved one was declared brain-dead and that hospital officials subsequently defied their wishes for treatment appear to be polar opposites but highlight same growing medical dilemma; cases raise questions about how a diagnosis of brain-death is determined and who has the right to decide how such patients are treated.

byline.original: By BENEDICT CAREY and DENISE GRADY

lead_paragraph: Two recent cases involving a patient kept alive by ventilator despite a diagnosis of brain death raise questions about exactly what this term means.

headline.main: At Issue in 2 Wrenching Cases: What to Do After the Brain Dies
